questions.question: What is the difference between seeing and observing according to this lecture?
questions.correct_answer: An animal sees but does not observe. Only humans observe. Observation is the artificial separation of a part from unified existence - it requires conscious distinction.

questions.question: What is a definition and how does it differ from a regular description?
questions.correct_answer: A definition is the shortest description of what is observed. While ten people may give different descriptions, the shortest description will be identical for everyone.

questions.question: What are fundamental terms and why is 'point' considered one?
questions.correct_answer: Fundamental terms have no definitions - they are ultimate concepts that exist only in the mind as pure abstraction. A point is fundamental because it is zero-dimensional and cannot be defined further. A pencil mark on paper is not a point but a spot.

questions.question: Explain the difference between a name and a term.
questions.correct_answer: A name is a word for a real object - it can be shown but cannot be described completely because real objects have infinite details. A term is a word for an abstract object - it cannot be shown but can be described completely and definitively.

questions.question: Why can't you visualize the number five itself?
questions.correct_answer: The number five is a pure abstraction - it's impossible to visualize. When you try, you either imagine five objects (a group) or the symbol '5' (a digit), but not the number itself. Numbers exist only as abstract concepts.
